title: Barcelona vs Inter Milan predicted line-ups: Team news and more ahead of Champions League clash
text:
Inter Milan travel to Barcelona for the match of day two in game week 2 sparking memories of their famous tie in 2010.

The Italians, under Jose Mourinho, outdid Pep Guardiola’s side, and eventually won their third European Cup, beating Bayern Munich in the final.

It denied the Catalans a historic three Champions League titles in a row, sandwiching Inter’s triumph with wins in 2009 and 2011.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

It has now been five years since their last Champions League title, with the clock ticking to capitalise on Lionel Messi’s prime.

Here’s everything you need to know about the game at the Nou Camp.

Team News

Lionel Messi is expected to miss out with an adductor problem, however, the Argentinian may be able to make the bench. Ousmane Dembele is also returning from injury and has only recently returned to training meaning he is unlikely to feature. Teenager Ansu Fati, who made a spectacular introduction into the first team, has also been ruled out.

Inter boast an injury-free squad with Alexis Sanchez expected to make the starting line-up after scoring twice before being sent off against Sampdoria last week.

Predicted Line-ups:

Barcelona: Ter Stegen; Semedo, Pique, Lenglet, Firpo; Busquets, Arthur, De Jong; Griezmann, Perez, Suarez.

Inter: Handanovic; D’Ambrosio, Godin, De Vrij, Skriniar, Asamoah, Sensi, Brozovic, Barella; Sanchez, Lukaku.

When is it?

Kick-off at the Camp Nou is at 8pm (BST) on Wednesday 2 October.

How can I watch it?

The match will be broadcast live on BT Sport ESPN and can be streamed live online via the BT app and website.

Odds

Barcelona 1/2

Draw 10/3

Inter 5/1
